intro: Astracantha baibutensis, commonly known as the Baibut sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is often found in steppe and desert regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
